result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D. Boelter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court reads-in and dismisses Counts 1, 3 & 5.
Defendant to report to Probation no later than Friday March 25, 2016 12:00 p.m.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Court notes 14 days credit if revoked.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber   DF:  Anthony D. Boelter appeared. Case called at 3:45 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for plea and sentencing. ADA Minser recites agreement. Files an amended information. Requesting restitution in the amount of $4,610.00 joint and several with Marcus Boelter.  In compliance with victim's rights. Victim is present today. State files a Victim Impact Statement with the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 7 Theft of Property in 15CF462 per the amended information. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 7 Theft Movable Property in 15CF462. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 1,3 and 5 but read in for restitution purposes only. Sentencing arguments. Atty Weber requesting a restitution hearing. 20 days to file appeal. Crt orders:

-    S/W 2 years probation. Report to probation no later than noon on Friday, March 25, 2016. DE able to serve probation in Minnesota. Bond will remain until reports to probation. 14 days jail credit if probation is revoked. 

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   DNA Sample 

-  Court costs in the amount of $268.00 and $250.00 DNA Surcharge. To be paid over the course of probation. Parties may argue court costs in writing within 10 days

-   Attend MRT program or any other cognitive therapy. TO BE DETERMINED BY THE PROBATION AGENT

-    AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-   Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.

-   May apply for expungement if successfully completes probation

-   Restitution is ordered but will be held open for a restitution hearing
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Interstate Compact for Juveniles signed by RMW this date. eif
Arraignment at 10-23-2015 02:00 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Brandon C., Briann R., Sharla L., Eric R. or their residences.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF462 and 15CF463:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber  and Atty T Gregory Amann DF:  Anthony D. Boelter appeared from jail and Marcus Boelter appeard from jail. Case called at 9:20 a.m. ADA Minser calls Elizabeth Posel to the stand. S/T Elizabeth Posel. Direct by ADA Minser. Witness identifies defendant's in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification of defendant's. No questions by Atty Weber. Cross by Atty Amann. Witness excused. ADA Minser calls Ryan Miller to the stand. S/T Ryan Miller. Direct by ADA Minser. Cross by Atty Weber. Cross by Atty Amann. Witness excused. No further witnesses by parties. Atty Weber gives argument. Atty Amann gives argument. ADA Minser gives argument and asking for court to find probable cause. Court at this time finds that there is probable cause and binds defendant's over for trial. ADA Minser requesting to schedule arraignment. ADA Minser states there is a warrant for the defendant's in MN. Court has a form that is titled Interstate Compact for Juveniles. Anthony Boelter has waived any and all rights to challenge Minnesota's request and will accept the waiver and voluntary consent to return to MN. Marcus Boelter has waived any and all rights to challenge Minnesota's request and will accept the waiver and voluntary consent to return to MN. Court will sign . Court will modify bond to a $1,000 signature bond with the same non monetary conditions.  Arraignment scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
